p: In 2018, Breugelmans et al. [ 24] explored the effects of publishing in open access journals and collaboration between European and sub-Saharan African researchers in the study of poverty-related disease. To this end they used the PubMed dataset but discovered that it is not suited to performing full bibliometric analysis; to deal with this issue they also utilized Web of Science as a data source. They discovered that there is an advantage for open access publications in terms of citations. In 2020, Head et al. [ 25] studied infectious disease funding. They discovered that HIV/AIDS is the most funded disease. Additionally, they discovered a pattern according to which Ebola, Zika, influenza, and coronavirus funding were highest after an outbreak.
